result.execSummary:
The defendant Isiah T Bland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 16 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isiah T Bland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Isiah T Bland in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weathers states that the Defendant is pleading guilty to the amended charge from the State.  Charge is being amended to a misdemeanor. State must file amended information by close of business on 07/08/16. Defendant enters guilty plea to count # 1 of Amended Information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1 of Amended Information. State gives sentencing recommendations. Defendant's wife makes a statement. Atty Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1 OF AMENDED INFORMATION:

FINE: $583.75 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50/month, commencing on 08/01/16, alternate is 16 days jail).   

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Isiah T Bland in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjournment for plea and sentence so Defendant can complete IMPACT course.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Isiah T Bland in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Isiah T Bland in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Isiah T Bland in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
